xml.title: On Speculative Fiction
xml.p: "Even a simple assertion like 2+3=5 is simply a simulation of "the real world." However, moving any of them even slightly (let alone shoving them all to the middle of the desk) alters the mass, weight, and volume of all the others. The system of "rigorously logical"arithmetic relationships is just one model of "the real." When we want to look at "the real world" with higher accuracy and sophistication than the rural schoolhouse allows, we need to employ models other than the arithmetically predictable to assist us understand what we're looking at: A quantitative analyst must have tables to compensate for the volumetric summation of various miscible liquids: Poured one pint of water"
